quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Words and Word
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, waddy, caravaggio. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Caravaggio was a Baroque painter, and this was the main subject in most of his artwork.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Young men

questions.question: Indomitable means unconquerable.
Only one of these sculptures is not a work of Antonio Canova, famous for his ability to delicately render nude flesh in his statues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Virgin

questions.question: Which of these words is defined as indifferent or nonchalant?
What is a privet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a type of shrub

questions.question: What word defines a person who lives in seclusion for religious reasons?
What noun refers to a bald-headed man or a man that is looked at with humor or mock pity?
Which of these words means loose hemp or jute fiber, occasionally treated with pitch or tar?
The word palmy means poor or underfunded.
The term waddy is a noun that means sailor.
What word means either cheerful and optimistic or having good digestion?
Which of these words means to be transitory or perishable?
Jocose means somber or depressed.
Typical of the baroque architecture, this was the paradigm of the basilica, mainly in Italy and France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crossed dome and nave

questions.question: Panoptic means having a panoramic view.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Dreamgirls and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, iridium, portray. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What word refers to an emperor of Japan?
In the movie Dreamgirls, who is the only  singer to have a child?
In which city does the movie Dreamgirls begin?
What is a killdeer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a bird

questions.question: Which one of these words denotes a type of shade tree?
Who portrays Effie Melody  White in the 2006 movie Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jennifer Hudson

questions.question: Milch is an adjective that can be put before which of the following words?
Where would find a half track?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the military

questions.question: Can you define the word nimbus?

options.text: an alcove or recess in a wall

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a halo or bright light

questions.question: In the movie Dreamgirls, this actress portrays Lorrell Robinson, the only original member of the group  who was never the lead singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anika Noni Rose

questions.question: What color is the Iridium?
Where would you find a jalousie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in a home or building

questions.question: What character does Beyonce Knowles portray in the 2006 movie Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deena Jones

questions.question: Who does Eddie Murphy portray in the film Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Thunder Early

questions.question: What is Jamie Foxxs role in the movie Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curtis Taylor, Jr.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Dreamgirls and Word
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which word means leave hurriedly or secretly?
In the movie Dreamgirls, this actor plays Marty Madison, an old time manager, who is pushed out  of business by Curtis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danny Glover

questions.question: Jamie Foxx, who stars in the movie Dreamgirls, sang the theme song for what 1999 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Any Given Sunday

questions.question: Jamie Foxx, Jessica Lange, Julianne Moore, Holly Hunter, Al Pacino, Sigourney Weaver, Barry Fitzgerald, Teresa Wright and Faye Bainter share what distinction?

options.text: They were nominated for both a lead actor/actress and supporting actor/actress Oscar in the same year.
Each was nominated for an Oscar for their first movie.
They are all alumni of USCs drama school.
They were nominated for Oscars in three consecutive years.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were nominated for both a lead actor/actress and supporting actor/actress Oscar in the same year.

questions.question: Which word means extravagance in cooking and/or serving?
Who originated the role of Effie on the Broadway production Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jennifer Holliday

What does abactor mean?

options.text: a doctor who heels back and / or spinal pain
a person who edits a book
a person who retracts a decree

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a cattle thief

questions.question: Which word means pertaining to grandparents?
Who originated the role of Deena Jones in the Broadway play Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sheryl Lee Ralph

questions.question: The original Broadway play Dreamgirls was designed to feature which actress/singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nell Carter

questions.question: This star from Boston Public is the only actress from the original Broadway cast of Dreamgirls who appeared (and sang) in the 2006 movie adaptation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loretta Devine

questions.question: How was the movie Dreamgirls rated?
Who directed the movie Dreamgirls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Condon

questions.question: What does the word axilla mean?

options.text: a medieval weapon with two sharp faces
a tiny worm found in Southern Europe
the part of a flower protecting the reproductive organs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an armpit

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Following and Greek Mythology
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, definition, watercolor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is Poseidon god of in Greek mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nature and the seas

questions.question: What is the definition of the word acoushla?

options.text: a type of two-person fishing boat used in Scotland and Northern Ireland
a type of gnome mentioned in Irish literature

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a term of endearment

questions.question: Goddess Demeter taught the human beings what according to Greek mythology?
Which of the following is not a movement in art history?
Apollo is the Greek god of the hunt.
Which of the following is not a type of pottery?
Which word means a person learning the alphabet?
Which of these qualities represents the major difference between watercolor and acrylic paints?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Level of opacity

questions.question: When creating a woodcut or linoleum print, you would generally carve out (or remove) which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Negative space

questions.question: When drawing the human form, the entire figure is generally how many heads tall?
Hestia is the goddess of the hearth in Greek mythology.
What does anatine mean?
Select the correct spelling.
What does acronyal mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: occurring at sunset

questions.question: While tempera paint rarely includes this ingredient nowadays, it was prevalent with the Byzantine artists of the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egg yolk

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Dance and Tango
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, dances, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Tango is a complicated dance with even more complicated origins. Angel Villoldo was the first to ever record a Tango. This is the home of Tango (and Angel Villoldo ).
The home country of Salsa is Brazil.
Quadrille was born as part of military parades in the 17th century and was performed by 4 horsemen and their horses.
Merengue was born in Portugal in the 16th century as part of an important ritual.

What style of art breaks from traditional perspective and depicts the subject matter from multiple points of view, fragmenting a three-dimensional form in order to depict it on the two-dimensional surface?
The method of watercolor painting in which paper, crumpled plastic wrap, or other items are applied to the paint when wet and removed after drying is called decalcomania.

Probably the most famous and influential ballroom dance is Waltz. Its closed position became an example for many other dances and made it very fashionable. Waltz first became popular in this city and then spread all over the world.

The word samba is probably derived from the Angolan semba, meaning a religious rhythm. The dance and its music were born in the black ghettos of this city. The biggest samba carnival is also held in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rio de Janeiro

questions.question: One of the symbols of the Spanish culture is the Flamenco (Flamenco originally meant Flemish in Spanish). At first Flamenco consisted only of unaccompanied singing, but later came the other essential ingredients, such as the dance and the guitar. What is the name of the flamenco guitar?
This Latin phrase means to a sickening or tiresome degree.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ad nauseam

questions.question: One of the most popular Latin American dances is cha-cha-cha. It became popular in the United States in the 1950s and its music was derived from the music of this dance.

One of the best (some say he was the best ever) tango dancers was Josе Ovidio Bianquet. His story is as mysterious as tango itself and his nickname is one of the most legendary in the history of this great dance. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Cachafaz

questions.question: A drawing in which one continuous line is used to trace the outlines of the subject matter, using more or less pressure to suggest shadow, is called what?

This is a Polish folk dance which became quite popular at ballrooms. It is in triple time and its tempo is usually moderate. It has spread all over the world in countries such as the United States, Russia and France.
Which of the following is not an ingredient in typical camera film?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Word and Place
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, places, clasp. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Native Americans knew this place as Mesconsing, Lewis and Clark recorded it as Quisconsing. Its name was further distorted. What do we know it today as?
A corrupted version of the Arabic word wadi, meaning watercourse, gives us this Spanish toponym.
What do the toponyms Rio Grande, Mississippi and Ta Ho mean in their native tongues?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big River

questions.question: In England, names of places ending in chester, like Manchester and Winchester come from a Latin word meaning what?
In debating, this term refers to an argument that attacks a persons character, as opposed to the subject of debate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ad hominem

questions.question: What does Sahara mean in Arabic?
Omaha is a distorted Native American tribal name.
Argentina comes from the Latin word Argentum which means silver.
Which one of these words means an ornamental clasp or pin?
Cairo means happiness in Arabic.
Which one of these words means to soil or defile?
What place in New York was named Vlissigen by the Dutch?
Pick the B word that does NOT mean to nag or intimidate.
For which monarch was the state of Virginia named?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Elizabeth I of England

questions.question: This is a label inside a book that bears the owners name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ex libris
